column4: rh7.3 was my nemesis for the longest while when i was setting it up.
I seriously wanted to pull my hair out.
I actually used rh up to release 9, then migrated to debian, now its ubuntu.
I tried rh8 - it stayed on my machine for 1 day before I installed Debian :)
lol. I didnt know any better.
I run it in mac-on-linux for windows media ( irony!)
definitely a meat package sounds tasty
your way is neater, but not so easy for people who don't know how :)
I wouldnt ignore ya, Youre not a jackass like xer
no, I'm a different kind of jackass ;-)
well you dont bug me so. yah :)
heheh - with a copy of the GPL as EULA , insisting that opening the package implies acceptance of the terms of the licence :)
